author: Staff Reporter
text:
In a verbal clash between farmers of Rajasthan’s Sriganganagar and district Collector P.C. Kishan on Monday over compensation for the crop damage due to recent rains and hailstorm, the Collector allegedly threatened the farmers that he could send them to “jail”.

A video of Mr. Kishan’s statement has emerged where he is telling the farmers: “Listen to what I’m saying, or I’ll put you in jail.”

During the meeting between the farmers and the Collector, the farmers pleaded for a survey on crop damage and then to compensate the farmers on the basis.

“Initially, the Collector was listening to the farmers, however, after many farmers joined in and started stressing on the survey and the compensation, Mr. Kishan lost his cool and threatened the farmers they could get them jailed if they didn’t listen to him,” a source present during the meeting told The Hindu .

“I haven’t seen the video yet. I think either a doctored video of mine has emerged, or only some part of my video is being shown,” Mr. Kishan said.
title: Collector ‘threatens’ dissenting farmers in Rajasthan
